2013 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/12/2017
Well, I've been a resident for the past 4 years. I have no complaints. The office staff is friendly and professional. I had a delicate matter, and it was taken care of with genuine care and concern. The maintenance staff is great, the grounds are always clean and free of trash and debri. I didn't experience many maintenance issues but if I had a issue it was always handled in a timely matter. Besides, they do routine maintenance, so you don't have to remember about a filter, or complain about pest, they do all of that own there own, just one of many perks being a resident. They spray regularly, you don't even have to ask. I would highly recommend this property to anyone, it's safe , clean and quiet! Last but not least I would like to thank the woodland creek staff for making my stay a pleasant one..

Resident
2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/30/2015
Where do I begin? The walls are paper thin, you will actually think your neighbors dog is in your house. Overpriced with 2001 style amenities..everything is old and outdated from kitchen appliances, style of home etc.. I hope you do not have a king size bed, because it will not make it up the stairs by any means. In the winter if your heating unit goes out in the heart of winter the wonderful staff provide you with one space heater for your entire home. I had to take my family to a hotel for 2 days and the office refused to take anything off my rent or cover my relocation costs. How could I forget the bugs and roaches..the place isn't riddled with cockroaches but be prepared to see some in your home from time to time, when the exterminator comes they will spray two squirts and go on about their way. The dryer does not ever fully dry your clothes, be prepared to make 2-3 trips to get them completely dry. When you decide to move out make sure the apartment is cleaner than when you move in you will be charged for damage that was already there and they will simply keep your deposit and apply as many cleanup charges as possible until it is exhausted. Be sure to get their cheap $20 carpet clean or you will be charged $60 for it. I lived in the last set of townhomes far away from the office and playground so the kids have nowhere to play but the parking lot area so expect scratches and dents from their toys and bikes to make it onto your vehicle. I enjoyed the upstairs option with these apartments and that was the selling point for me. Other than that everything else was just subpar, these units have gone up in rent every year and what are the tenants getting for rise in costs? Nothing..Not a bad area at all but you can find much better bang for your buck.

2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/28/2015
I cannot wait to get out of this place. When I first moved in the fan above the stove was broken, leaking water, and covered in black mold. Some outlets didn't work, and the plugs would fall out of the ones that did. There was an ever growing water spot on the ceiling in the living room. The toilets were filthy. The bathroom tiles were caked with dirt and God only knows what else. All the cabinets were sticky inside and out. There were dark, mold like stains in the carpet. The screen door was broken. There was a decently large gap between the front door and it's frame, nor did it lock properly. And the apartment was infested with milipeeds and a few roaches. Those are the issues I noticed ON THE DAY I MOVED IN. Before the move in, when viewing my specific unit, I had addressed most of these issues with the property manager and had been assured they would be handled. Obviously they were not. It continued to get worse from there. The milipeed infestation grew to the point that I was disposing of at least 50 a day. That isn't an exaggeration, I started counting because it had become such an issue. I called maintenance about the problem several times; literally nothing was done. Appliances break down constantly. Parts of my washing machine completely detatced during the cycle, tearing and ruining my bed comforter. It took forever to fix because when you make an appointment for maintenance, the office staff rarely submits the request the first time it is called in. On multiple occasions maintenance has not shown up until the fourth or fifth request has been made. The toilets are continually breaking. Either they constantly run or the tanks will not fill with water. At this point I've given up on getting the upstairs toilet fixed. Thank God I have two, as I only have to call when both of them are broken. The tiles in my shower keep falling out. When they replace tiles I can't use my shower for 24 hours. But for whatever reason they won't replace them all at once. Last time they replaced tiles they also had to cut out and replace the section of wall behind the tiles because it was covered in mold. And yesterday at 8am I was woken up by an emergency clean up team tearing the floors and walls out of the apartment next to mine. As far as I can tell, they are doing it because of mold. And they've left a six foot tall pile of trashbags leaned against the fence I share with the apartment. The bags are filled with pieces of the walls they are tearing out. Several bags busted open and spilled, presumably modly, chunks of installation onto my pourch. I called the office about the noise and inquired about how long it would be going on, more or less I was told 'too bad, because they have to start their work at 9am'. Even a written notice about the noise/construction would have been appreciated so that I could make arrangements to avoid issues. But the bottom line is management does not consider their tenents when they make decisions. Management: When a request is made to fix an issue, or you're asked to clean something up to insure a pleasent living environment for your renters; just do it. Because ultimately that's what you're there for.
I cannot wait to get out of this place. When I first moved in the fan above the stove was broken, leaking water, and covered in black mold. Some outlets didn't work, and the plugs would fall out of the ones that did. There was an ever growing water spot on the ceiling in the living room. The toilets were filthy. The bathroom tiles were caked with dirt and God only knows what else. All the cabinets were sticky inside and out. There were dark, mold like stains in the carpet. The screen door was broken. There was a decently large gap between the front door and it's frame, nor did it lock properly. And the apartment was infested with milipeeds and a few roaches. Those are the issues I noticed ON THE DAY I MOVED IN. Before the move in, when viewing my specific unit, I had addressed most of these issues with the property manager and had been assured they would be handled. Obviously they were not. It continued to get worse from there. The milipeed infestation grew to the point that I was disposing of at least 50 a day. That isn't an exaggeration, I started counting because it had become such an issue. I called maintenance about the problem several times; literally nothing was done. Appliances break down constantly. Parts of my washing machine completely detatced during the cycle, tearing and ruining my bed comforter. It took forever to fix because when you make an appointment for maintenance, the office staff rarely submits the request the first time it is called in. On multiple occasions maintenance has not shown up until the fourth or fifth request has been made. The toilets are continually breaking. I have only lived here for about a little over a month now. So far, my experience has been great! The office staff, has been very helpful and friendly. Maintenance requests are taken care of promptly (often same day or next day). It is my first time living on my own, and the office staff, especially Stephanie, has made this an easy transition for me. The price is well worth what you receive, the area is quiet, and seems to be made up of mostly working families, with pleasant kids. I have had no bad experiences thus far. When I first moved in I noticed some bugs, which is obviously normal because of the all of the trees, but I called the office and they had an exterminator come out promptly and since then I have had no issues, they also came out the same day and put "rubber material" around the front door as to keep the cracks sealed. They are very attentive to the needs of their residents, very friendly, prompt and helpful. I have absolutely no cons. If I had to pick one it would be the computers are a slow in the lab, but so what I have a laptop and there is a library down the street. They still work and you can print for free. The gym is great, the pool is great, the parking is great, the location is great, there's even a park for the kids, and a pool table in the nicely furnished community room. Again, I have no concerns, but if I did, I have the confidence in the staff that it would be taken care of. They have great customer service skills, and pleasant personalities. I feel safe here, I am a nurse and work rotating shifts but, never feel unsafe walking to my place from my car, the parking is right in front of my place, and my neighbors are friendly and helpful. Again, I have only been here for a little over a month so far. But, the staff including maintenance, have gone above and beyond my expectations. I have already referred people to them.

Verified Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2014
Woodland Creek Townhomes may not be the most luxurious apartments in the area, but they don't skimp on service and provide a good value in a good community. The apartments are a little older (mid 70's is my guess) with basic appliances and the apartments and grounds are generally well maintained. You'll need to buy your own microwave, but a dishwasher and garbage disposal are included. With some basic energy awareness (nothing too drastic ) I keep my electricity bill under $100 per month for a 1 bedroom townhome apartment. The community is generally quiet and my neighbors are pleasant. Most importantly, I only hear my neighbors occasionally, and only when my apartment is very quiet (no appliances running, and the TV/Stereo are off) and then they are just barely auditable, but not loud enough to be an annoyance. The office staff is terrific! Although I've only been in the office a few times since my arrival more than a year ago they always greats me cheerfully, by name, and a with a sincere desire to assist with any issue. They entire staff is very professional, courteous, and friendly. I often drive or walk past a member of the maintenance staff and they have never failed to smile and wave. Most importantly the few maintenance problems I've had in my 16 months of residence have all been attended to promptly and correctly by their consummate professions. They have always treated me like a valued resident and I would recommend Woodland Creek to anyone that is looking for a basic apartment in a good neighborhood with superior service.

2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/03/2013
I never thought I would be writing a negative review of this place, but here it is. I was blindsided when I viewed the model apartment; I thought this place was great. I find myself counting down the months until I can leave. Here is why I feel this way: 1. My neighbors: I caught my neighbor going through my car! He actually opened the door, was in my car, and was going through my things! I caught him in the act and he did not apologize. He made up some lame excuse that he didn't know who the car belonged to. Now I feel extra cautious and I don't feel safe going outside at night. 2. The noise: You can hear when your neighbors are in the bathroom like when they flush the toilet and even some disturbing bathroom noises. People (at least my neighbors) play music all times during the day. You can feel it through the walls. You can also hear kids screaming all during the day and night. 3. The children: The children play in the parking lot leaving their toys everywhere, which means you have to be careful when you park so you don't hit a bicycle or even a child! I don't know where their parents are! If I had children I would not let them play in a parking lot...there is a playground onsite! Also, the children touch your car and leave things on them. Again this is the role of the parents to teach them not to do this, but it is still annoying. 4. Weekend Parties: There are parties every weekend here and no it is not college age kids; it is adults having these fiestas with their children running rampant outside! When I wake up in the morning, I walk outside and can smell beer in the air. 5. The apartment itself: I am pretty sure my allergies are flaring up because I suspect mold growing somewhere in this apartment. They are old apartments but who know when the carpet was last changed. I do like my apartment layout but that is about it. Overall, I do not recommend living here. I was unaware of all of these problems when I signed my lease. The office people were very nice so either they are unaware of these problems or overlook them. Good luck apartment hunting!

Report
Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/05/2008
I moved into Penrith a few months ago (even though I was hesitant after reading the reviews). I always saw the sign from the road and thought it was the "projects" but it is actually not that bad. The encounters that I have had with the staff were all pleasant. Each time I requested maintenance, it was fixed within a day. Of course, now that summer is approaching, I do hear a lot more noise and see more people riding around, but what do you expect from an apartment complex? My building is actually close to the office, so ordinarily, I don't hear any noise at all. Most of the noise comes from cars riding by blasting music. I have to admit, it was a little difficult to get my mattress up the stairs because the corners are tight, but it wasn't to the point where it couldn't be done. The dishwashers and the refridgerators could use a little upgrading, well actually the whole kitchen could use an upgrade. But as I said, it is livable. I am considered to be very "bourgeoise" and I chose to live here, mostly because of the free month's rent; so if I can do it, anybody can. As far as the bug situation, it may depend on which building you live in because I have only seen two small spiders since I have been there, and that was recent. Also, if you have a lot of trees around, you should expect to see some outside bugs, especially when it starts to get warm. The parking is good, I park directly in front of my building without any problems. I have been "hollered at" since I have been living here, but that can happen anywhere, men will be men. I say just smile and keep it moving. The pool is really nice, it's like 9ft deep. The business center is really nice. There are about 15 computers internet-ready and the gym is awesome too! They even have a sauna that you can use. All in all, I would give it a 2.75 out of 5, mostly because the place is old, I mean it was built in the 80's. Once you add your own personal touch to the place, it won't be as bad as people say. Besides, where else can you get a townhouse with 2 baths for $600? If you want to experience affordable townhouse living in the RTP, I say try it. But try to get in a building close to the office.

2002 - 2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/31/2006
I have rented an apartment at Penrith for several years now. All the issues cited here are pretty much on the money. Noise issues galore, bugs, etc. One thing I haven't seen mentioned as much is the maint staff. There are people in your apartment all the time. Most of the time there's no info why, or any communication ahead of time. More than once I've come out of the shower to find staff in my apartment. Complaints fall on deaf ears. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay for a short time near RTP, this may be ok for you, but there are better options for longer term stays. I'm counting down the says until my lease is up.
I have rented an apartment at Penrith for several years now. All the issues cited here are pretty much on the money. Noise issues galore, bugs, etc. One thing I haven't seen mentioned as much is the maint staff. There are people in your apartment all the time. Most of the time there's no info why, or any communication ahead of time. More than once I've come out of the shower to find staff in my apartment. Complaints fall on deaf ears. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay for a short time near RTP, this may be ok for you, but there are better options for longer term stays. I'm counting down the says until my lease is up. Resident
2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/24/2004
I have not had a problem with the Latin population here. It is the African Americans. Our neighbor blasts his music from midnight to three almost every morning. Reporting them has not helped the situation for long, not even for 24 hours. Many of the African Americans come in late at night blast they music out of their cars and honking. Weekly someone is throwing a noisey party that never seems to end. The layout for the garden apartments SUCK!!! Our bedrooms are right next to someone's living rooms and the walls are paper thin. Many times the pictures on our wall rattle from the vibrations. The washer and dryer SUCK! It is the top loading dryer and the door always seems to hit me in the head no matter how hard I try and stop it. The dishwasher is so horrible. To get most dishes clean I either have to wash them and then load the dishwasher or keep them in the dishwasher for 4 cycles. The dishwasher is placed in the wrong spot in the garden apartments. I can't use under the sink to store anything that deals with the dishwasher, because I can't get to it when I need it. There is no pantry for storing any entertaining items or kitchen items. The tubs/ showers need updating. Before moving in they refinished (?) the tubs protective coating and now after 6 months it is coming off. The tub area is also very small with the annoying sliding doors that make it impossible to reach the towels. The mirror is so small it is laughable, if you are shorter then 5'6" you'll never see yourself in the mirror/ medicine cabinet (it also make you look distorted). The bugs are a big problem here. They "sprayed" but I think what they sprayed attracts the bugs not kills them. Not very goos air cirrulation either. Small closet spaces and ugly cheap carpet. Most of the doors are not hung correctly and either don't shut or are hard to open.

Resident
2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/07/2003
I moved in on a really great special but there are a couple minor things that really put a bad taste in my mouth. Penrith has a great view but in return you must cope with variuos CREATURES. My fiance´ was chased by possums one night because our neighbors left thier trash out ; and one morning walking my 14-month old daughter outside there were several snakes cicling the bushes.....so there must be mice somewhere. Let´s not get on the bugs on the inside of my apartment ..you know those little creepy things with all the whiskers that sneek in the tops of your ceilings I´ve got plenty of those..Ummmmm...roaches check......spiders check.....millepedes check...it´s disgusting. Especially when I moved in and everything was sparkling clean and white and before I got my new furniture I noticed all the bugs...they must have got them to hide away right in time for me to move in . Oh and what´s the point of having a washer/dryer that doesn´t wash and dry . The aplliances are so out of date my washer machine and Fridge have been replaced and I´ve only been here 7 months. They refuse to replace my dryer that I know is running my power bill up to 100.00 plus a month because it takes 3 hours to dry 1 load. I work six days week so it´s not possible that I use 100.00 worth of power . The staff is unprofessional their not personable, nor efficient. Maintenance does not speak to you as they pass. The nicest person I´ve met was the exterminator and you know that´s BAD. The pool staff tells the police lies....based off of their own assumptions. So if you do decide to live here don´t stay near the office,Tammy, or the pool. Be prepared bring some bug spray...act like a jackass so maybe when you see one of the community´s representatives you won´t feel so bad if they don´t speak to you. Overall theres has been no robberies, break-ins, domestic disputes, loud music and my power stayed on when the hurricane came so I can´t complain. I expect more out of them because I personally work in the real industry as well.

Leasing

Amid tall trees on a gently rolling landscape, you will be able to enjoy your leisure hours relaxing by the pool, reading a book under a tree, taking the pups for a walk, working out at the gym or working from the business center. Take advantage of our great location just minutes away from movie theaters, restaurants, shopping centers, night spots, and more! You deserve the best and can have it all at Woodland Creek Townhomes & Apartments.
